quarks.execution.services

Class ServiceContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.execution.services.ServiceContainer

  • public class ServiceContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a container for services.

    The current implementation does not downcast the provided service class when searching for an appropriate service implementation. For example: 

       class Derived extends Base {}
 
   serviceContainer.add(Derived.class, instanceOfDerived);
 
   // Searching for the base class returns null
   assert(null == serviceContainer.get(Base.class, instanceOfDerived));

    • Method Detail

      • addService

        public <T> T addService(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass,
                        T service)
        Adds the specified service to this ServiceContainer.

        Associates the specified service with the service class. If the container has previously contained a service for the class, the old value is replaced by the specified value.

        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the class of service to add.
        service - service to add to this container.
        Returns:
        the previous value associated with serviceClass, or null if there was no registered mapping.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified service class or service is null.

      • removeService

        public <T> T removeService(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
        Removes the specified service from this ServiceContainer.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the class of service to remove.
        Returns:
        the service previously associated with the service class, or null if there was no registered service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified service class is null.

      • getService

        public <T> T getService(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
        Returns the service to which the specified service class key is mapped, or null if this ServiceContainer contains no service for that key.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the class whose associated service is to be returned
        Returns:
        the service instance mapped to the specified service class, or null if no service is registered for the class.

      • addCleaner

        public void addCleaner(BiConsumer<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> cleaner)
        Registers a new cleaner.

        A cleaner is a hook which is invoked when the runtime closes an element of Job. When an element of job is closed cleaner.accept(jobId, elementId) is called where jobId is the job identifier and elementId is the unique identifier for the element.

        Parameters:
        cleaner - The cleaner.

      • cleanOplet

        public void cleanOplet(java.lang.String jobId,
                       java.lang.String elementId)
        Invokes all the registered cleaners in the context of the specified job and element.
        Parameters:
        jobId - The job identifier.
        elementId - The element identifier.
